SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.percussion.cms.objectstore
Interface IPSFieldValue

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSBinaryFileValue, PSBinaryValue, PSDateValue, PSFieldValue, PSTextValue, PSXmlValue
public interface IPSFieldValue
extends Cloneable

Base interface for any type of value contained by an PSItemField. Sub-interfaces should implement accessor methods appropriate for the type of value they support.

Method Summary
 Object clone()
          Creates a new instance of this object, deep copying all member variables.
 boolean equals(Object obj)
          Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.
 Object getValue()
          Gets the data contained by this value as an object.
 String getValueAsString()
          Gets the data contained by this value as a string.
 int hashCode()
          Must be overridden to fulfill contract of this method as described in Object.
 

Method Detail

getValue

Object getValue()
Gets the data contained by this value as an object. If the value is a binary value, it may not be retrieved from the server until this method is called. If there is an error, a RuntimeException may be thrown.

Returns:
The data contained by this value. The type of object will depend on the type of data the field specifies it contains. May be null.
Throws:
RuntimeException - if there is an error lazily loading binary data from the server.

getValueAsString

String getValueAsString()
                        throws PSCmsException
Gets the data contained by this value as a string. This effectively enforces a toString implementation on the object being return in getValue().

Returns:
The data contained by this value as a String. May be empty, never null.
Throws:
PSCmsException - implementers may need this, if conversions are not so easy.

clone

Object clone()
Creates a new instance of this object, deep copying all member variables. If an implementing class has mutable member variables, it must override this method and clone() each of those variables. This method will create a shallow copy if it is not overridden.

Returns:
a deep-copy clone of this instance, never null.

equals

boolean equals(Object obj)
Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. All implementing classes must override this method as the default behavior is not desired. If the implementation does not follow the contract documented for this method in Object, then it must clearly state how it deviates from that contract.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
obj - the reference object with which to compare.
Returns:
true if this object is the same as the obj argument; false otherwise. If null supplied or obj is not an instance of this class, false is returned.

hashCode

int hashCode()
Must be overridden to fulfill contract of this method as described in Object. Object because equals(Object) was overridden.

Overrides:
hashCode in class Object
Returns:
A hash code value for this object
